faq.answer.about.whatIsLU: Literary Universe is a platform for writers and readers to create, share and discover stories and worlds.
faq.question.about.difference: What is the difference between Literary Universe and other online reading platforms?
faq.answer.about.difference: Literary Universe is all-in-one platform which means it includes tools for writing, reading, worldbuilding, and community building. The key difference is inclusion of all these tools together in one platform and their interconnectedness.
faq.answer.about.dataLocation: Literary Universe data is stored on servers in the United States of America, specifically AWS us-east-1 region.
faq.answer.about.incorporation: Literary Universe is incorporated in the Czech Republic. You can find more details on the about us page.
faq.question.about.roadmap: What are the next steps for Literary Universe?
faq.answer.about.roadmap: This is constantly evolving. Check out our roadmap for more details.
faq.question.settings.changeTheme: How do I change the look of Literary Universe?
faq.answer.settings.changeTheme: Registered users can change their theme in the account settings under "site theming" section. We have a light and a dark theme available. If you are not registered, then we try to determine which theme to serve you based on your browser and operating system settings.
faq.question.settings.changeAvatar: How do I change my avatar?
faq.answer.settings.changeAvatar: You can change your avatar in the profile settings.
faq.question.settings.changeLanguage: How do I change the language?
faq.answer.settings.changeLanguage: You can change the language of Literary Universe in the account settings.
faq.question.settings.translationMistake: I found a mistake in the text on the website, where can I report it?
faq.answer.settings.translationMistake: All our language files are available on GitHub. You can submit an issue there or in the Bug section of the feedback, or if you are so inclined, you can fix it directly yourself via our Crowdin page.
faq.answer.discovery.explain: The Discovery section is where you can find new stories, universes, blogs, groups and other content. It is a place to explore and find new things to read and enjoy.
faq.question.discovery.filters: How can I filter stories by genre, language, or tags?
faq.answer.discovery.filters: Use the filter panel at the top of the Discovery search page to narrow down stories by genre, language, tags, and more.
faq.answer.discovery.recommendations: Recommendations are based on your reading history, followed authors, and genres you like.
faq.question.discovery.hide: Can I hide or block certain stories or users from Discovery?
faq.answer.discovery.hide: Yes, explicit content is by default blocked and you can filter search results to your likes. In your settings you can also disable specific genres by default. More options will come in the future.
faq.question.discovery.inappropriateCont: How do I report inappropriate content in Discovery?
faq.answer.discovery.inappropriateConten: If you find inappropriate content, click the 'Report' button (sometimes just a flag icon) on the story or user profile. Our moderators will review your report as soon as possible.
faq.question.writer.howToCreateStory: How do I create a new story in Literary Universe?
faq.answer.writer.howToCreateStory: You can create a new story by going to the workshop and clicking on one of the create buttons or go to the main create page where you can select a new standalone story or fan fiction. To create a new story in a universe, go first to that universe and then select "stories" on the dashboard and on the next page click the big red button on the right side of the page title. You will be asked to fill in the details of your story and then you can start writing.
faq.question.writer.schedule: How do I schedule a chapter to be released in Literary Universe?
faq.answer.writer.schedule: You can schedule a chapter to be released when clicking on the publish button in the chapter editor. A modal will be shown where you will have the option to schedule a release or publish immediately. If you choose to schedule a release, you will be asked to select the date and time when you want the chapter to be released. We recommend scheduling chapters at least 24 hours in advance to give readers time to prepare for the new chapter and to release on the same day and time of the week.
faq.question.reader.creativeTypes: What is the difference between Universe, Stories and Fan Fiction?
faq.answer.reader.creativeTypes: Universe is a place where you can find all the stories and other content related to a specific literary world. Stories are either standalone stories or part of a universe that. Fan Fiction is a story that is based on another literary universe created by someone else.
faq.question.reader.navigation: How do I navigate between chapters and sections while reading?
faq.answer.reader.navigation: Use the navigation arrows or the chapter list to move between chapters and sections. You can also use keyboard shortcuts for faster navigation.
faq.question.reader.settings: How do I adjust reading settings like font size or theme?
faq.answer.reader.settings: Click the settings icon in the reader toolbar to change font size, theme (light/dark), and other display options. You can also set your default preferences in your settings.
faq.question.reader.bookmarks: How do I bookmark my place in a story?
faq.answer.reader.bookmarks: Bookmarks are set automatically as you read. On the story overview you can see which chapters have you read and when.
faq.question.reader.progress: How do I track my reading progress?
faq.answer.reader.progress: Your progress is saved automatically and shown as a progress bar or percentage in the reader and your library. On the story overview you can see which chapters have you read and when.
faq.question.reader.accessibility: What accessibility features are available in the reader?
faq.answer.reader.accessibility: The reader supports adjustable font sizes, Dyslexic font, ruler that tracks your mouse, differentiating paragraph colors, dark and light themes, keyboard navigation, and screen reader compatibility.
faq.question.reader.supportedFormats: What formats are supported by the reader?
faq.answer.reader.supportedFormats: The reader supports stories, universes, and other content created on Literary Universe. External formats like EPUB or PDF are not currently supported.
faq.question.reader.troubleshooting: What should I do if the reader is not working correctly?
faq.answer.reader.troubleshooting: Try refreshing the page or clearing your browser cache. If problems persist, contact support with details about your issue.
faq.answer.workshop.explain: The Workshop is where you can create new stories, fan fiction, universes, and other content. It is a place to write, edit and manage your creative content.
faq.question.workshop.creativeTypes: What is the difference between Universe, Stories and Fan Fiction?
faq.answer.workshop.creativeTypes: Universe is a central place for your literary universe in which you create stories that inhabit the same literary world, manage encyclopedia with all the intricacies of your world and do anything else related to it. Fan Fiction is a story that is based on another story or universe created by someone else. Standalone stories are stories that are not connected to any universe, use this for example for poetry or literary works that are set in real world without many characters or immersive details that would require encyclopedia or other benefits of having a universe.
faq.question.workshop.continueStory: How do I continue a previously created story?
faq.answer.workshop.continueStory: You can continue a previously created story by going to the workshop and selecting the story you want to continue or if it is a story in a universe, you need to first go to the universe and select the story from the stories listing. On the story dashboard you can then click on the chapter you want to continue writing or create a new chapter.
faq.answer.workshop.whatIsALicense: A story license is a legal document that defines how your story/universe can be used by others. It is a way to protect your rights and to define how others can use your work.
faq.answer.workshop.licenses: We offer a variety of licenses to choose from. When creating a new work in the licenses section will be a button which will list all available licenses with their full details. In general we offer full copyright protections and Creative Commons licenses.
faq.answer.workshop.guildOwnership: Guild ownership indicated a work that is owned by an organization. This could be a publisher or another type of a company or non-profit organization. The ownership of the work is usually bit more complex and the author might not have full control over the work, it mainly means that the work is managed through the organization and not by the author from their personal account.
faq.question.workshop.howToInviteCollabo: How do I invite collaborators for a story/universe?
faq.answer.workshop.howToInviteCollabora: You can invite collaborators to your story/universe by going to the story/universe dashboard and clicking the "collaborators" button. There you can invite other users to collaborate on your story/universe by entering their username and selecting the role you want to assign to them.
faq.question.workshop.howToTranslation: How can I translate my story or universe?
faq.answer.workshop.howToTranslation: You can translate your story or universe by going to the story/universe dashboard and clicking the "Translations" button. There you can add a new translations for your work and if you have someone to do the translation you can invite them to join on the translation. From there you can also manage the translations yourself.
faq.question.workshop.betaReaders: What are Beta Readers and what is their purpose to my story?
faq.answer.workshop.betaReaders: Beta readers are people who read your story before it is published and give you feedback. They can help you find mistakes, give you ideas for improvement, and help you make your story better.
faq.question.workshop.hiatus: What is a hiatus in the story status?
faq.answer.workshop.hiatus: Hiatus is a status for your story that indicates that you are taking a break from writing and publishing new chapters. It is a way to let your readers know that you are not actively working on the story at the moment. This status gets set automatically after 6 months without any new chapters. After additional 6 months of inactivity the story will be marked as cancelled.
faq.question.workshop.finished: How do I indicate that my story is finished?
faq.answer.workshop.finished: You can indicate that your story is finished by going to the story dashboard and on the bottom there is a green button which says "Change story status to Completed". This will mark the story as finished adjusting the last page to tell the readers that the story is finished and to check out your other works. It will also indicate so in discovery making your story more visible to readers who are looking for finished stories.
faq.question.workshop.seo: What is the use of SEO-Friendly-Address in various settings?
faq.answer.workshop.seo: SEO-Friendly-Address is a way to make your story, universe, blog post more visible to search engines and easier to read URL for humans. It is a way to make your work more discoverable and to help people find your work when they search for something similar.
faq.question.workshop.descriptionLength: Độ dài tối ưu cho mô tả cốt truyện và thế giới là bao nhiêu?
faq.answer.workshop.descriptionLength: Hãy cố gắng giữ độ dài mô tả trong khoảng 150-160 ký tự để đảm bảo mô tả của bạn cung cấp đủ thông tin mà không bị cắt ngắn trong kết quả tìm kiếm. Điều này giúp cải thiện khả năng hiển thị của tác phẩm trên các công cụ tìm kiếm và nền tảng mạng xã hội. Một mô tả được viết tốt trong khoảng này sẽ hiển thị đầy đủ trong kết quả tìm kiếm của Google và bản xem trước trên mạng xã hội, từ đó tăng khả năng thu hút độc giả.
faq.question.workshop.createProject: How do I start a new universe in the Workshop?
faq.answer.workshop.createProject: Go to the Workshop and click on the 'Create' button, then select an universe. You can start a new standalone story, fan fiction, or a story within a universe.
faq.question.workshop.editingTools: What editing tools are available in the Workshop?
faq.answer.workshop.editingTools: The Workshop is the creative center where you control your content. At the top you can create universes and standalone stories. From there on you select your work and more options will open to you. Universe will present you with the option to create stories in it, manage universe encyclopedia, universe page, forums, collaboration and much more. With stories you will have a full suite of tools to write in a WYSIWYG editor, manage collaborators, sharing, version management, etc.
faq.question.workshop.story: How do I create a new story in the Workshop?
faq.answer.workshop.story: Go to the Workshop and click on the 'Create' button, then select a story. If you haven't written any standalone story there will be a button in that section to take you straight to story creation. For stories in a universe, select that universe, then click on the 'Stories' button and there you can create a story that will be set in that universe.
faq.answer.workshop.saveDrafts: Drafts are saved automatically as you write, and you can also manually save your progress.
faq.question.workshop.collaboration: How does collaboration work in the Workshop?
faq.answer.workshop.collaboration: You can invite others to collaborate on your story or universe. Use the 'Collaborators' feature to add co-authors, translators, beta readers or editors (this role is in development).
faq.question.workshop.revisions: How do I manage revisions and history?
faq.answer.workshop.revisions: Every time you create a revision it is saved in the database. You can view comments on previous revisions through the editor or in version history.
faq.question.workshop.exporting: How can I export my work from the Workshop?
faq.answer.workshop.exporting: We are currently working on the export feature and publication on other platforms (for non-exclusive works).
faq.question.workshop.troubleshooting: What if the Workshop is not saving or loading my work?
faq.answer.workshop.troubleshooting: Check if there are any error messages visible anywhere, then check your internet connection and try refreshing the page. If issues persist, contact support for help.
faq.question.library.addItem: How do I add a story or universe to my library?
faq.answer.library.addItem: You can add a story or universe to your library by clicking the 'Add to Library' button on the story or universe page. Once added, it will appear in your library for easy access and you will get notified about any developments with that story or universe.
faq.question.library.removeItem: How do I remove something from my library?
faq.answer.library.removeItem: Go to your library or that universe or story, find the item you wish to remove, and click the 'Remove' or trash icon next to it.
faq.question.library.sync: Why is my library not syncing across devices?
faq.answer.library.sync: Make sure you are logged in with the same account on all devices. If issues persist, try logging out and back in, or contact support.
faq.question.library.share: Can I share my library or make it public?
faq.answer.library.share: Currently, your library is private and only visible to you. You can use public reading lists to prepare what you want to share. We are working on features where you will be able to share these in the near future.
faq.question.library.missing: How do I recover missing items in my library?
faq.answer.library.missing: If you notice missing items, try refreshing the page or logging out and back in. If the problem persists, please contact support.
faq.question.library.deletedStory: What happens if a story is deleted by the author?
faq.answer.library.deletedStory: Published stories can not be deleted by the author, but there are some exceptions like copyright and rules violations. If that is the case then the story will no longer be accessible or visible in your library. For other cases of copyrighted material the story might no longer be accessible publicly or for new readers, but if you have bought the story or added it to your library you will still be able to access it.
faq.question.encyclopedia.creating: How do I create a new encyclopedia entry?
faq.answer.encyclopedia.creating: Go to the Encyclopedia section and click the 'Add Entry' button in the menu or in the specific category of the menu. Fill in the details and save your entry.
faq.question.encyclopedia.editing: How do I edit or update an encyclopedia entry?
faq.answer.encyclopedia.editing: Open the entry you want to edit and click the 'Edit' button. Make your changes and save.
faq.question.encyclopedia.categories: Can I organize entries into categories?
faq.answer.encyclopedia.categories: Yes, you can assign categories and parent entries to entries when creating or editing them for better organization.
faq.question.encyclopedia.links: Can I link encyclopedia entries to stories or universes?
faq.answer.encyclopedia.links: Yes, you can link entries to related stories, universes, or other encyclopedia entries.
faq.question.encyclopedia.visibility: Who can see my encyclopedia entries?
faq.answer.encyclopedia.visibility: You can set entries or part of entries to be public or private.
faq.question.encyclopedia.troubleshootin: What if I can't find or edit an entry?
faq.answer.encyclopedia.troubleshooting: Try refreshing the page. If the issue persists, check your permissions or contact support.
